title: Frontend-only dark-luxury visual redesign with unified page shell and typography system

requirements.summary: Introduce a shared page shell to enforce a consistent top offset under the fixed header and a uniform vertical rhythm across all routed pages without altering navigation/content/functionality.
acceptanceCriteria: All routed pages render their first meaningful content below the fixed header (no overlap).
A single, consistent approach is used site-wide (e.g., a shared page wrapper / page shell) rather than ad-hoc per-page fixes.
No text content, routes, or functional behavior changes (authentication flow, wallet read-only labels, links) are introduced as part of this change.

file_operations.description: Create a shared PageShell component that applies a uniform top offset (accounting for the fixed header) and standard vertical spacing for page content; keep it presentation-only (no behavior changes).
Wire PageShell into the global layout so the routed Outlet content always renders below the fixed header using a single site-wide approach (no per-page header-offset hacks).
Add/standardize global layout tokens (e.g., CSS variables for header height and page gutters) and shared utilities used by PageShell to ensure consistent vertical rhythm across the app.

requirements.summary: Visually redesign the critical pages (Home, login entry points and unauth screens, AR, Map, Profile, Rules) for cohesive spacing/alignment/typography while preserving existing content and interactions.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page layout is visually balanced on mobile and desktop: consistent padding, aligned center content, and no elements clipped by the viewport or header.

Login entry points are visually consistent: the Header login button styling matches the new system, and auth-required screens (e.g., Wallet/Swap unauthenticated states) match the same typography/spacing rules.
If AR/Map/Profile/Rules pages exist in the codebase (including placeholder pages), they use the same redesigned page shell, typography scale, and spacing system as Home/Wallet/Swap.
No backend calls, React Query behavior, or identity logic is changed.

file_operations.description: Refactor Home page layout to use the redesigned spacing/typography system and ensure its hero content sits comfortably below the fixed header on all breakpoints; preserve all existing text and interactions.
Adjust header presentation (spacing, alignment, hover/focus styling) to match the redesigned dark-luxury system while keeping existing navigation items and behavior unchanged.
Update only the Login button presentation (spacing/typography/interaction states) to align with the new design system; do not change authentication logic, labels, or query cache clearing behavior.
Redesign Wallet page visual layout (including unauthenticated screen and read-only banner) to use the shared PageShell/container/typography rules; preserve all wording, links, and behaviors.
Redesign Swap page visual layout (including unauthenticated screen and read-only banner) to use the shared PageShell/container/typography rules; preserve all wording, links, and behaviors.
Align AR Distribution page spacing/typography and section structure with the redesigned page shell and component composition; preserve all existing educational/disclaimer text.
Apply the redesigned page shell, typography scale, and spacing system to this AR placeholder page (presentation-only), without adding new AR functionality.
Apply the redesigned page shell, typography scale, and spacing system to this Map placeholder page (presentation-only), without adding new Map functionality.
Apply the redesigned page shell, typography scale, and spacing system to this Profile placeholder page (presentation-only), without adding new profile functionality.
Apply the redesigned page shell, typography scale, and spacing system to this Rules placeholder page (presentation-only), without adding new rules content beyond existing placeholders.

requirements.summary: Standardize typography scale, spacing tokens, containers, and composition rules (cards/badges/buttons/banners) across pages without modifying shadcn/ui source files.
acceptanceCriteria: Heading hierarchy is consistent across pages (e.g., H1/H2 sizing and font usage) and does not vary arbitrarily between Home, Wallet, Swap, Landing, Docs/Legal pages.
All primary page sections use consistent max-width and horizontal padding conventions (e.g., container usage) for mobile/tablet/desktop.
Buttons, cards, and banners (including the 'Read-Only – Transfers Disabled' banners) maintain their wording but have consistent spacing, alignment, and responsive behavior.
No Shadcn UI component source files under frontend/src/components/ui are modified (compose instead).

file_operations.description: Create a small Container component (composition-only) to standardize max-width and horizontal padding rules for page sections across the site.

Create shared Typography helpers (e.g., PageTitle/SectionTitle/BodyText class presets) to enforce consistent heading hierarchy and body text styling across pages (composition-only; no shadcn/ui edits).
Create a shared ReadOnlyBanner component to unify spacing/alignment for the existing 'Read-Only – Transfers Disabled' banner across pages while preserving the exact wording.
Update Landing page to use the shared Container/Typography components and consistent spacing rules; preserve content and existing links/interactions.
Standardize Docs hub layout using the shared Container/Typography components and consistent card grid spacing; preserve all section titles, descriptions, and links.
Standardize Gold Paper page typography hierarchy (H1/H2/section titles), spacing rhythm, and container widths using the shared design primitives; preserve all existing text and anchor links.
Align QMY Token page typography scale, card spacing, and container usage with the shared design system; preserve all existing content.
Replace page-specific container/padding patterns with shared Container/Typography and reuse ReadOnlyBanner for consistent composition while keeping content and behavior unchanged.
Replace page-specific container/padding patterns with shared Container/Typography and reuse ReadOnlyBanner for consistent composition while keeping content and behavior unchanged.

requirements.summary: Refine the existing dark+gold theme into a cohesive dark-luxury system with consistent surfaces, borders, and interaction states across header/footer/pages while maintaining accessibility.
acceptanceCriteria: The site uses a consistent set of surface styles (backgrounds, glass cards, borders) and interaction states (hover/focus/disabled) across Header, Footer, and main page content.
No new product features are introduced; only visual/presentation improvements are made.
Theme changes do not reduce accessibility (text contrast remains readable on dark backgrounds).

file_operations.description: Refine theme tokens for a polished dark-luxury system (surface layers, borders, text tones, focus rings) and add shared utility classes for consistent surfaces/interactions across the app.
Adjust/extend Tailwind theme mappings (colors/shadows/typography) to reflect the refined dark-luxury palette and consistent interaction states, keeping existing dark+gold direction.
Apply the refined surface/border/hover/focus styling to the fixed header so it matches the new theme system while keeping navigation and behavior unchanged.
Apply the refined surface/border/typography styling to the footer to match the new theme system while preserving all links and content.
Unify StatusBadge presentation (spacing, typography, surface/border treatment) to align with the dark-luxury system while preserving statuses and their meaning.
